alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 3:07AM EST until December 29 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Chester, Philadelphia and Montgomery Counties. For the Schuylkill River...including Philadelphia near 30th Street, Berne, Reading, Pottstown, Norristown, Philadelphia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Norristown. * WHEN...From early this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. At 15.0 feet, River Road in West Conshohocken begins to flood. The lower garages at the Riverview Landing and the Lofts at Valley Forge start to take on water. The lower section of Port Indian Road in West Norriton becomes impassable. At 16.0 feet, The Upper Merion Boathouse starts to flood. At 17.0 feet, A couple industries along the river begin to have flood problems. Water begins to cover rails in Conshohocken. Septa tracks at Mogees in Plymouth Township begin to flood. Ross Street in Plymouth Township at the Sewer Authority Plant floods under the railroad bridge and bike trail. Flooding also occurs along Diamond Run at Station Road (in Plymouth Township off of Conshohocken Road) due to high and backwater effects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 16.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 07/12/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 12.3 Thu 2 am 12.8 10.9 16.5 1pm 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM EST.
